text: Jan Roar Leikvoll (7 June 1974 - 1 August 2014) was a Norwegian author. He was born in Bergen. Leikvoll made his debut in 2008 with the novel A Winter Story, followed by The Violins (2010), The Bovara Monastery (2012) and The Songbird in 2013. He was awarded Nynorsk Literature Prize for The Violins and Stig Sæterbakkens memorial prize for his three first novels.Leikvoll fikk Stig Sæterbakkens minnepris Leikvoll died on 1 August 2014 from a brain tumor, aged 40. ==References== Category:1974 births Category:2014 deaths Category:Deaths from brain cancer Category:Norwegian writers Category:People from Bergen
title: Jan Roar Leikvoll
